column3: Site name may be defined based on the name of the location.
column4: Latitude of the site (e.g., center of the site) in decimal degree following WGS84 system
column5: Longitude of the site (e.g., center of the site) in decimal degree following WGS84 system
column6: Surface elevation with respect to mean sea level
column7: Description of surface geology. If available, indicate geoloty unit in parentheses [e.g., Alluvial plain (Qa)].

column4: Detailed description of the associated file (e.g., site plan, cross-sectional map, Google Earth KML/KMZ, GIS file).

column2: ID used for the activity at this location. Once created, cannot be changed.
column3: Latitude of activity in decimal degree following WGS84 system
column4: Longitude of activity in decimal degree following WGS84 system
column5:
Type of activity. Four options:
  • Borehole
  • Cone penetration test (CPT)
  • Test pit
  • Geophysical investigation
column6: Surface elevation with respect to mean sea level.
column7: Final depth of boring/penetrating activity or maximum wave length.

column4: Detailed description of the associated file (e.g., original data, profile image).

column3: General information for borehole and boring.
Type of boring (e.g., Rotary wash, Hand auger)
column4: Depth to ground water table from surface of borehole
column5: Name of logger / organization (e.g., Dong Youp Kwak / UCLA)

column3: Geology and soil information for a stratigraphic layer
Depth to the top of layer.
column4: Depth to the bottom of layer.
column5: Soil classification code for the layer (e.g., SC, ML by USCS)
column6: Soil color code for the layer (e.g., 10YR 2/1 by Muncell color system)
column7: General geologic and soil description for the layer.

column3: Geology and soil information for a specific depth within a layer

column4: Description of soil at this depth

column3: Standard Penetration Test (SPT) results with the method following ASTM D1586-11 standard
Depth of the top of main blows
column4: Penetration depth from depth top (main drive only; e.g., 30 cm)
column5: Number of blow counts for main drive
column7:
Hammer drop system. Example:
- Rope-cathead Trip
- Semi-automatic
- Automatic
Another system can be described.
column8: Method (i.e., standard) followed if different from ASTM D1586-11.

column3: General information for static cone penetration test followed by ASTM D5778-12 standard
Surface area of cone tip (e.g., 10 cm2 or 15 cm2)
column4: Nominal rate of penetration of the cone (e.g., 2 cm/s)
column5: Depth of ground water table from surface
column6: Name of logger / organization (e.g., Dong Youp Kwak / UCLA)
column7: Method (i.e., standard) followed if different from ASTM D5778-12

column3: Data of static cone penetration test followed by ASTM D5778-12 standard
Depth to the base of pit
column5: Name of logger / organization (e.g., Dong Youp Kwak / UCLA)

column4:
Sampler type. Example:
- Shelby tube
- Split-barrel (SPT)
- Bulk (test pit)
- CPT sampler
column5: Depth to the top of sample.
column6: Depth to the base of sample.
column9: Sample soil description (e.g., gray silty CLAY)

column5: Detailed description of the associated file (e.g., lab test report, charts, testing photos).

column3: General information for laborotory tests, location of specimens

column4: Reference specified for a specimen within a sample
column5: Depth to the top of specimen from the surface of borehole
column6: Depth to the bottom of specimen from the surface of borehole
column7: Name of testing technician and organization (e.g., Dong Youp Kwak / UCLA).

column3:
Index tests include
- density (ASTM D7263-09),
- water content (ASTM D2216-10), and
- atterberg limit tests (ASTM D4318-10e1).

Standards recommended for each test are in parentheses.

column4: Reference specified for a specimen within a sample
column12:
Method (Standard) used for index tests if different from recommended standards:
- density: ASTM D7263-09;
- water content: ASTM D2216-10;
- atterberg limit: ASTM D4318-10e1.

column3: Test results (% passing for a specific sieve) from sieve anlaysis

column4: Reference specified for a specimen within a sample

column3: Other tests not specified above. Any format of test results can be uploaded.

column4: Reference specified for a specimen within a sample
column5:
Test type. Options:
- Consolidation
- Triaxial-UU
- Triaxial-CU
- Triaxial-CD
- Triaxial-cyclic
- Simple shear-monotonic
- Simple shear-cyclic
- Others
column8: File containing the test result. Mandatory if other test is uploaded.

column3: General information for geophysical test. Select test type, then data upload boxes will be shown up.
Second location ID (for cross-hole type test only)
column4: Third location ID (for cross-hole type test only)
column5:
Test type.
- Surface wave (e.g., SASW, MASW)
- Down-hole type
- Cross-hole type
- Suspension logging type (e.g., Suspension logging, SCPT)
column6:
Test configuration dependent on test type. Example:
Surface wave: sensor layout, inversion analysis used for Vs profile estimation
Downhole-type: source-to-sensor horizontal distance
Crosshole-type:
Suspension logging-type:
column7: Name of logger / organization (e.g., Dong Youp Kwak / UCLA)

column2: Surface Wave Geophysical Test - Dispersion Curve

column3: Wave length of dispersion curve. Either wave length or frequency is required.
column4: Frequency of dispersion curve. Either wave length or frequency is required.
column5: Average phase velocity of dispersion curve

column2: Surface Wave Geophysical Test - Vs Profile
column3: Shear wave velocity (Vs) profiles after inversion analysis.
Depth top of a layer decided from inversion analysis
column4: Depth bottom of a layer decided from inversion analysis
column5: Shear wave velocity of a layer

column3: Downhole-type Vs and/or Vp measurement. Original field data (e.g., travel time to top and bottom layer from surface source) can be uploaded as an associated file.
Depth of measurement or top of interval
Crosshole-type Vs and/or Vp measurement. Original field data (e.g., travel time from source to receiver) can be uploaded as an associated file.
Second location ID (for cross-hole type test)
column4: Third location ID (for cross-hole type test)
column6: Shear wave velocity measured between Location ID and Location ID 2. At least one of Vs is required.
column7: Shear wave velocity measured between Location ID and Location ID 3. At least one of Vs is required.
column8: Shear wave velocity measured between Location ID 2 and Location ID 3. At least one of Vs is required.
column9: P-wave velocity measured between Location ID and Location ID 2.
column10: P-wave velocity measured between Location ID and Location ID 3.
column11: P-wave velocity measured between Location ID 2 and Location ID 3.

column3: Suspension logging-type Vs and/or Vp measurement. Original field data can be uploaded as an associated file.
Depth of the middle of measurement

column8: Event date and time. Format: Year-MonthDay-HourMinute

column4: Strike of the fault segment ruptured first
column5: Dip of the fault segment ruptured first
column6: Rake of the fault segment ruptured first
column7: Length of the fault segment ruptured first
column8: Down dip width of fault segment ruptured first
column9: Latitude of upper left corner of the fault segment ruptured first
column10: Longitude of upper left corner of the fault segment ruptured first
column11: Depth of upper left corner of the fault segment ruptured first

column3:
Yes if site is colocated with sesimic station.
No if site is away from seismic station so that IMs should be interpreted.
Data associated with field performance (e.g., site plan, aerial image)
The name can be a type of the associated file (e.g., SP for site plan, AI for aerial image).
column4: Detailed description of the associated file.

Field observation. Select multiple options applicable.

Measured displacement (mdsp): Check if any sort of measured displacement is available.
Lateral deformation (ldfm): Check if lateral deformation is observed.
Settlement (sttl): Check if vertical settlement is observed.
Sand boil (sndb): Check if sand boil is observed.
Post-event deformation (pedf): Check if post-event failure is observed.
column5:
Type of observation.
- Field Note (note)
- Field mapping (fmap)
- Reconnaissance photo (phto)
- Satellite image (stim)
- Repair report (rprp)
Or, any other description (othr).
column6: Latitude of observation in WGS84. If nothing entered, latitude for a site is assigned.
column7: Longitude of observation in WGS84. If nothing entered, longitude for a site is assigned.
column9: Associated file. Mandatory if observation type is Photo, Report, or Field mapping.

column4: Intensity measures from recorded ground motion or inferred using selected ground motion model. Upload data associated with ground motions (e.g., acceleration time series, Fourier spectra, resonse spectra) as an associated file.

Type of ground motion intensity measures.
- PGA (g): Peak ground acceleration
- PGV (cm/s): Peak ground velocity
- PSA_T0.2 (g): Pseudo spectral acceleration at 0.2 sec period
- PSA_T1.0 (g): Pseudo spectral acceleration at 1.0 sec period
- PSA_T3.0 (g): Pseudo spectral acceleration at 3.0 sec period
- CAV5 (m/s): Cumulative absolute velocity after application of a 5 cm/sec2 threshold acceleration
- D595 (sec): Duration between 5% and 95% of Arias intensity
column5:
Measured if IM is measured from nearby seismic station.
Interpolated if IM is interpolated using Kriging method.
GMM if IM is inferred from a GMM.
column6: Standard deviation of selected IM in natural log unit

column3: Data associated with ground motions (e.g., acceleration time series, Fourier spectra, resonse spectra)
The name can be a type of the associated file (e.g., acceleraion time series, response spectra).
column4: Detailed description of the associated file.
